posts.post_content:
I use it with [Telepathy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Telepathy), [Steel of the godhead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel of the godhead), and [Gwafa hazid, Profiteer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gwafa hazid, Profiteer)  
  
That was it's unblockable, I know what's in their hand, and i can force them to draw a card each turn so they have a hand.

Posted By: Cyberium (11/6/2010 12:18:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is pretty great even when not in EDH. The deck i run uses mostly one of a kind flyers so its easy to tutor them out. works especially well with [Steel of the Godhead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel of the Godhead) and [Ocular Halo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ocular Halo). Plus the upkeep of flyers lets [Luminarch Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Luminarch Ascension) get to its 4 quest counters. plus [Stormtide Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stormtide Leviathan) prevents non-flyers from attacking. Plus if you get Steel of the Godhead on Isperia you can just give him [Magebane Armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magebane Armor) until stormtide hits the field
posts.html:

Posted By: Latronis (5/28/2011 8:09:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: i run twin copies of this beautiful lady in a U/W deck, classic Azorius playstyle around flying and tapping. the thing i Cannot Stress Enough is that, even on the first swing you call wrong, YOUR OPPONENET HAS TO REVEAL THEIR HAND. just remember what theyve got and watch what they play (having a photographic memory helps ftw). twin Sage Owls, and Telling Times help get what i need, twin Aven Mimeomancers (almost all the cards in it are in twin sets, as i've found it most effective; greatest still-reliable variety) plenty of tapping cards, Sleep, Fulgent Distraction, Plumes of Peace, and, to use that to its fullest, twin Palliation Accords and a searchable-with-Isperia Sunblast Angel. it may be flying- heavy, but i PREFER to play Against heavily-anti-flying decks for the Challenge of it and i STILL win. Isperia my dear, you are the epitome of versatility.
posts.html:

Isperia my dear, you are the epitome of versatility.
